Package main

Class IR_Audit

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.IR_Audit
  • public class IR_Audit
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents an IR_Audit and contains methods to print to an audit file.

      void writeBallotsReallocated​(IR_Ballot[] currentBallots, int currentBallotCount)
      Writes what ballots are being reallocated and/or may thrown out upon next reallocation to the audit file.
      void writeCandidatesBallots​(Candidate[] candidates, int numCandidates)
      Writes candidates who are still in the running to the audit file with their vote count and the respetive IDs of the ballots given to the candidates.

      Writes header information about election type, total number of candidates, name of candidates, and number of total ballots of an IR Election to an audit file.

      Writes the name of the candidate removed from the audit file.

      Writes the candidates who tied with the lowest vote to the audit file.
      void writeTiedWinnerCandidates​(Candidate[] candidates, int[] tieFolk)
      write the names of tied candidates who tied in popularity vote Only works with to candidates and with a tieFolk array of size 2.
      void writeWinner​(Candidate[] candidates, int winner)
      Writes the name of the candidate who won to the audit file.

      • IR_Audit

        public IR_Audit​(java.lang.String date)
        Constructor for IR_Audit. Initallizes fields filename, auditFile, and audit writer. Sets date to parameter date.
        Parameters:
        date - string, represents the date at which the election was run

      • IR_Audit

        public IR_Audit()
        default constructor for IR_Audit. Initalizes date and file name to be empty and auditFile and auditWriter to be null

    • Method Detail

      • writeHeaderToFile

        public void writeHeaderToFile​(java.lang.String electionType,
                              int numCandidates,
                              Candidate[] candidates,
                              int numBallots)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Writes header information about election type, total number of candidates, name of candidates, and number of total ballots of an IR Election to an audit file. Does not check if candidates is null orif numCandidates is out of bounds
        Parameters:
        electionType - String, represents type of election
        numCandidates - int, represents total number of candidates
        candidates - , Candidate[], array of candidate objects to get name and party of candidate
        numBallots - int, number of total ballots sent in the election
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeBallotsReallocated

        public void writeBallotsReallocated​(IR_Ballot[] currentBallots,
                                    int currentBallotCount)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes what ballots are being reallocated and/or may thrown out upon next reallocation to the audit file. Does not check if current ballot count is in bound and may fail if too high or too low. Does not check if IR_Ballot is null
        Parameters:
        currentBallots - IR_Ballot[], represents a list of ballots that will be reallocated
        currentBallotCount - int, represents the number of ballots that will be reallocated
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - raised if write failes

      • writeCandidatesBallots

        public void writeCandidatesBallots​(Candidate[] candidates,
                                   int numCandidates)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes candidates who are still in the running to the audit file with their vote count and the respetive IDs of the ballots given to the candidates. Does not check if candidates is null or if numCandidates is out of bounds, may fail
        Parameters:
        candidates - Candidate[], the list of total candidates
        numCandidates - int, the number of total candidates
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - raised if write fails

      • writeTiedLoserCandidates

        public void writeTiedLoserCandidates​(Candidate[] candidates,
                                     int[] tieFolk)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the candidates who tied with the lowest vote to the audit file. Does not check if indexes of tie folk is in bounds or if candidates or tieFolk is null Will fail is so.
        Parameters:
        candidates - Cadidate[], represents the list of total candidates
        tieFolk - int[], an array with index's that correlate to the tied candidates
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - raised if write fails

      • writeTiedWinnerCandidates

        public void writeTiedWinnerCandidates​(Candidate[] candidates,
                                      int[] tieFolk)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        write the names of tied candidates who tied in popularity vote Only works with to candidates and with a tieFolk array of size 2. Does not error check and will fail if tieFolk is greater than size 2, if any idexes are out of bouds, or if either is null
        Parameters:
        candidates - Cadidate[], array of all candidates
        tieFolk - int[], and array of ints with the indecies corresponding to the tied candidates
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - raised if write fails

      • writeLoser

        public void writeLoser​(Candidate[] candidates,
                       int loser)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the name of the candidate removed from the audit file. Does not error check if index of loser is in bound and will fail if not in bound
        Parameters:
        candidates - Candidate[], list of all candidates
        loser - int, index corresponding to the removed candidate
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - raised if write fails

        Parameters:
        candidates - Cadidate[], array of all candidates
        winner - int, index correlating to the winning candidate
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - raised if write fails
